::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**M1.3 Photic coral reefs**](/efg-info/M1_3.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/M1_3_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: M1.3.web.orig v1.0.

> Indicative maps of Photic coral reefs were obtained from Institute for Marine Remote Sensing et al. (2011). Occurrences were converted to 30 arc second spatial resolution.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**Corals500m** (IMaRS/USF 2011):

Source of _validated distribution records_.
 Resolution: <1km2, static.
 Accuracy evaluation: qualitative (experts judgement).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset    |url                                                                                                       |
|:----------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|Corals500m |<http://datasets.wri.org/dataset/tropical-coral-reefs-of-the-world-500-m-resolution-grid>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Selection* :: *Buffering*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Medium quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Direct,specific*.

Ground observations are _yes_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Qualitative expert assessment,documented,qualitative*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Indicative Map (**code: M1.3.IM.orig**, version v1.0) 
 - Web navigation (**code: M1.3.web.orig**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**M1.3.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M1.3.IM.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

**M1.3.web.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M1.3.web.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090929){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.M1_3_web_orig){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](layers/M1.3.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](M1.3.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map have similar licenses, but please check the license information below.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset    |license_info                                                                                     |
|:----------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|Corals500m |https://www.wri.org/research/permissions-licensing, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ |


:::
:::

## References

References used in this version of the maps.

- Institute for Marine Remote Sensing, University of South Florida  (2011) *Global Coral Reefs composite dataset* **Reefs at Risk Revisited project**  Compiled from multiple sources, incorporating products from the Millennium Coral Reef Mapping Project prepared by IMaRS/USF and IRD.
